meanings.definition: To climb or move up using a ladder or stairs.
meanings.sent1: She escaladed the ladder to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter escaladed the stairs to rescue the cat.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel escaladed the tree trunk with ease.
meanings.sent4: His determination escaladed him to the summit of the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The hiker escaladed the rocky path with steady steps.

meanings.definition: To scale or climb a wall or obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The skilled climber escaladed the rock wall effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The ninja escaladed the fence to sneak into the garden.
meanings.sent3: The spider escaladed the window screen in search of insects.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition escaladed her over every challenge she faced.
meanings.sent5: The adventurer escaladed the ancient ruins to uncover hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: To make one's way up or over something difficult or steep.
meanings.sent1: The determined hiker escaladed the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: The explorer escaladed the icy slope to reach the summit.
meanings.sent3: The cat escaladed the tall bookshelf to reach its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His perseverance escaladed him through the toughest times.
meanings.sent5: The mountaineer escaladed the treacherous cliff with caution.
